events.name: Bluemix for IT SME (Small and Medium Enterprises) and Startups
events.description: IBM Bluemix is a Platform-as-a-Service (Paas) that supports several programming languages and services as well as integrated DevOps to build, run, deploy and manage applications on the cloud. It will be a hands-on workshop to learn about building apps on Bluemix. Participants will get an opportunity to deploy their application and have it running in a matter of hours. This session will cover the following: - Intro by IBM - Fundamentals of Bluemix - Building Mobile app - Chat app and Sales Chart app in no time - Register and hands-on with Bluemix *Bring your own laptop Register here for your Bluemix account.
events.location: IDA Labs @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, Nation Design Centre, IDA Labs @ 03-04, Singapore 188969

events.name: Tuesday 9th of June
events.description: Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along! ---------- FAQs ---------- What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Don't forget! Is this free? Yes! We provide tea, coffee and milo and usually something for dinner. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Like Rails Girls, the Ruby Tea Party is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcome as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! I know nothing about programming, is this for me? Yes! We are happy to teach anyone with any experience, if you are a quick learner that makes it even better.

events.name: An evening on Post Video Productions
events.description: Color Video Grading, a 2-part series by Lynus Hee Movies often use colours to emote a story. To give your videos the cinematic look you don't need fancy machines or softwares to do it. Adobe Certified Instructor Lynus Hee will explain the theory behind colour grading and demonstrate a method that can be used in Adobe Photoshop, Premiere Pro and After Effects. Meet Our Speaker Lynus Hee Apart from a great sense of humour, I have 18 years of experience as a motion graphics designer and photographer. I am also an Adobe Certified Instructor (Video Specialist) and provide training for Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe After Effects. Register Here https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-jun-meeting-2015-tickets-17224128833

events.name: Book Club: High Performance Browser Networking
events.description: We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance This week we'll be covering Chapter 7 & 8: Mobile Networks & Optimizing for Mobile Networks. Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong Rd Singapore 437032 Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Hackware v0.8
events.description: Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. Agenda & Talks for this meetup: 1. Intro to BLE Part 2 - BLE programming on iOS, Raspberry Pi and demoing the use of a BLE sniffer - Yeo Kheng Meng 2. MakerFaire Singapore - Kiruthika Curic 3. Rollicking Ruby Robots Rule the World - Sau Sheong Chang & Shipeng Xu 4. Socialize and Network with other Hackware members We need speakers! and demos! let us know if you have something!
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore
